New Records: Youri Tielemans’ strike after 1 minute and 13 seconds is Belgium’s earliest ever goal at a major tournament and the third-fastest in UEFA European Championship history.
Belgium’s victory leaves Group E as the most open in Euros history with all four teams tied on three points.
Key Match Events: Kevin De Bruyne inspired Belgium with a dominant performance, scoring a second goal and creating multiple chances.
Youri Tielemans scored the third-fastest goal in Euro history, transforming the game’s dynamics.
Post-Match Reflections: Belgium’s win continues their history of at least one victory in each major tournament appearance.
The match highlighted the resilience and potential of Belgium’s squad, despite initial doubts.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jan Vertonghen became the oldest player to appear for Belgium at the Euros, marking a significant milestone.
Others: The game’s outcome left Group E on a knife edge, with all teams still in contention for advancement.
